intro: Onuris reichei, commonly known as the Reiche's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers, which typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is known for its delicate, often hairy leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
